alert.note: Alert for Emmet; Hancock; Humboldt; Kossuth; Palo Alto (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 27 at 4:54PM CDT by NWS DesMoines
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Emmet, Kossuth, Hancock, northern Humboldt and eastern Palo Alto Counties through 545 PM CDT... At 451 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a small cluster of strong thunderstorms 7 miles southeast of Ingham Lake, or 12 miles northeast of Emmetsburg, moving southeast at 40 mph. The small cluster of storms has produced wind gusts around 35 mph at both Jackson, MN and Estherville. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Algona, Emmetsburg, Garner, Britt, Swan Lake, Five Island Lake, Ingham Lake, High Lake, Eagle Lake, Union Slogh, Armstrong, Graettinger, West Bend, Bancroft, Swea City, Burt, Whittemore, Titonka, Ringsted and Wesley. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.

area.areaDesc: Emmet; Hancock; Humboldt; Kossuth; Palo Alto
